info.title: Azure Analytics Purview Data Map
info.description:
Purview Data Map Service is a fully managed cloud service whose users can
discover the data sources they need and understand the data sources they find.
At the same time, Data Map helps organizations get more value from their
existing investments. This spec defines REST API of Purview Data Map Service.

post.description:
Create or update an entity.
Existing entity is matched using its unique guid if
supplied or by its unique attributes eg: qualifiedName.
Map and array of
collections are not well supported. E.g., array<array<int>>, array<map<string,
int>>.
For each contact type, the maximum number of contacts is 20.

parameters.name: businessAttributeUpdateBehavior
parameters.description:
Used to define the update behavior for business attributes when updating
entities.

values.name: Ignore
values.description: Ignore the business attribute payload for update.

values.name: Replace
values.description: Replace all the business attributes using the payload.

values.name: Merge
values.description: Merge the business attributes. Business attributes will not be updated if not provided.

parameters.name: collectionId
parameters.description:
The collection where entities will be moved to. Only specify a value if you
need to move an entity to another collection.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Body parameter.

get.description: List entities in bulk identified by its GUIDs.

parameters.name: guid
parameters.description: An array of GUIDs of entities to list.

parameters.name: minExtInfo
parameters.description: Whether to return minimal information for referred entities.

parameters.name: ignoreRelationships
parameters.description: Whether to ignore relationship attributes.

post.description:
Create or update entities in bulk.
Existing entity is matched using its unique
guid if supplied or by its unique attributes eg: qualifiedName.
Map and array
of collections are not well supported. E.g., array<array<int>>,
array<map<string, int>>.
For each contact type, the maximum number of contacts
is 20.

parameters.name: collectionId
parameters.description:
The collection where entities will be moved to. Only specify a value if you
need to move an entity to another collection.

parameters.name: businessAttributeUpdateBehavior
parameters.description:
Used to define the update behavior for business attributes when updating
entities.

values.name: Ignore
values.description: Ignore the business attribute payload for update.

values.name: Replace
values.description: Replace all the business attributes using the payload.

values.name: Merge
values.description: Merge the business attributes. Business attributes will not be updated if not provided.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Body parameter.

delete.description:
Delete a list of entities in bulk identified by their GUIDs or unique
attributes.

parameters.name: guid
parameters.description: An array of GUIDs of entities to delete.

post.description: Associate a classification to multiple entities in bulk.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Body parameter.

204.description: There is no content to send for this request, but the headers may be useful.

post.description: Set classifications on entities in bulk.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Body parameter.

get.description:
Bulk API to retrieve list of entities identified by its unique attributes.
In
addition to the typeName path parameter, attribute key-value pair(s) can be
provided in the following
format

typeName=\<typeName>&attr_1:\<attrName>=\<attrValue>&attr_2:\<attrName>=\<attrValue>&attr_3:\<attrName>=\<attrValue>

NOTE:
The attrName should be an unique attribute for the given entity-type.
The REST
request would look something like this

GET
/v2/entity/bulk/uniqueAttribute/type/hive_db?attr_1:qualifiedName=db1@cl1&attr_2:qualifiedName=db2@cl1

Note:
at least one unique attribute must be provided.

parameters.name: typeName
parameters.description: The name of the type.

parameters.name: minExtInfo
parameters.description: Whether to return minimal information for referred entities.

parameters.name: ignoreRelationships
parameters.description: Whether to ignore relationship attributes.

parameters.name: attr_N:qualifiedName
parameters.description:
Qualified name of an entity. E.g. to find 2 entities you can set
attrs_1:qualifiedName=db1@cl1&attrs_2:qualifiedName=db2@cl1. (This is only an
example. qualifiedName can be changed to other unique attributes)

post.description: Upload the file for creating Business Metadata in BULK

parameters.description: InputStream of file

Get complete definition of an entity given its GUID.

parameters.name: minExtInfo

put.description:
Update entity partially - create or update entity attribute identified by its
GUID.
Supports only primitive attribute type and entity references.
It does not support updating complex types like arrays, and maps.
Null updates are not possible.

get.description:
Get complete definition of an entity given its type and unique attribute.

In
addition to the typeName path parameter, attribute key-value pair(s) can be
provided in the following format:
attr:\<attrName>=<attrValue>.

NOTE: The
attrName and attrValue should be unique across entities, eg.
qualifiedName.

The REST request would look something like this:
GET
/v2/entity/uniqueAttribute/type/aType?attr:aTypeAttribute=someValue.

parameters.name: typeName
parameters.description: The name of the type.

parameters.name: minExtInfo
parameters.description: Whether to return minimal information for referred entities.

parameters.name: ignoreRelationships
parameters.description: Whether to ignore relationship attributes.

parameters.name: attr:qualifiedName
parameters.description:
The qualified name of the entity. (This is only an example. qualifiedName can
be changed to other unique attributes)

put.description:
Update entity partially - Allow a subset of attributes to be updated on an
entity which is identified by its type and unique attribute eg:
Referenceable.qualifiedName. Null updates are not possible.

In addition to the
typeName path parameter, attribute key-value pair(s) can be provided in the
following format:

attr:<attrName>=<attrValue>.
NOTE: The attrName and
attrValue should be unique across entities, eg. qualifiedName.

The REST
request would look something like this:
PUT
/v2/entity/uniqueAttribute/type/aType?attr:aTypeAttribute=someValue.

parameters.name: typeName
parameters.description: The name of the type.

parameters.name: attr:qualifiedName
parameters.description:
The qualified name of the entity. (This is only an example. qualifiedName can
be changed to other unique attributes)

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Body parameter.

delete.description:
Delete an entity identified by its type and unique attributes.
In addition to
the typeName path parameter, attribute key-value pair(s) can be provided in the
following format:
attr:\<attrName>=\<attrValue>.
NOTE: The attrName and
attrValue should be unique across entities, eg. qualifiedName.

The REST
request would look something like this:
DELETE
/v2/entity/uniqueAttribute/type/aType?attr:aTypeAttribute=someValue.

parameters.name: typeName
parameters.description: The name of the type.

parameters.name: attr:qualifiedName
parameters.description:
The qualified name of the entity. (This is only an example. qualifiedName can
be changed to other unique attributes)

delete.description:
Delete a given classification from an entity identified by its type and unique
attributes.

parameters.name: typeName
parameters.description: The name of the type.

parameters.name: classificationName
parameters.description: The name of the classification.

parameters.name: attr:qualifiedName
parameters.description:
The qualified name of the entity. (This is only an example. qualifiedName can
be changed to other unique attributes)

204.description: There is no content to send for this request, but the headers may be useful.

put.description: Update classification on an entity identified by its type and unique attributes.

parameters.name: typeName
parameters.description: The name of the type.

parameters.name: attr:qualifiedName
parameters.description:
The qualified name of the entity. (This is only an example. qualifiedName can
be changed to other unique attributes)

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: An array of classification to be updated.

204.description: There is no content to send for this request, but the headers may be useful.

post.description: Add classification to the entity identified by its type and unique attributes.

parameters.name: typeName
parameters.description: The name of the type.

parameters.name: attr:qualifiedName
parameters.description:
The qualified name of the entity. (This is only an example. qualifiedName can
be changed to other unique attributes)

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: An array of classification to be added.

204.description: There is no content to send for this request, but the headers may be useful.

put.description:
Add given labels to a given entity identified by its type and unique
attributes.

If labels is null/empty, no labels will be added.

In addition to
the typeName path parameter, attribute key-value pair(s) can be provided in the
following format: attr:<attrName>=<attrValue>.

NOTE: The attrName and
attrValue should be unique across entities, eg. qualifiedName.

The REST
request would look something like this: PUT
/v2/entity/uniqueAttribute/type/aType?attr:aTypeAttribute=someValue.

parameters.name: typeName
parameters.description: The name of the type.

parameters.name: attr:qualifiedName
parameters.description:
The qualified name of the entity. (This is only an example. qualifiedName can
be changed to other unique attributes)

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: set of labels to be added

204.description: There is no content to send for this request, but the headers may be useful.

post.description:
Set labels to a given entity identified by its type and unique attributes.

If
labels is null/empty, existing labels will all be removed.

In addition to the
typeName path parameter, attribute key-value pair(s) can be provided in the
following format: attr:<attrName>=<attrValue>.

NOTE: The attrName and
attrValue should be unique across entities, eg. qualifiedName.

The REST
request would look something like this: POST
/v2/entity/uniqueAttribute/type/aType?attr:aTypeAttribute=someValue.

parameters.name: typeName
parameters.description: The name of the type.

parameters.name: attr:qualifiedName
parameters.description:
The qualified name of the entity. (This is only an example. qualifiedName can
be changed to other unique attributes)

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: set of labels to be set

204.description: There is no content to send for this request, but the headers may be useful.

delete.description:
Delete given labels to a given entity identified by its type and unique
attribute.

If labels is null/empty, no labels will be removed.

If any labels
in labels set are non-existing labels, they will be ignored, only existing
labels will be removed. In addition to the typeName path parameter, attribute
key-value pair(s) can be provided in the following format:
attr:<attrName>=<attrValue>. NOTE: The attrName and attrValue should be unique
across entities, eg. qualifiedName. The REST request would look something like
this: DELETE
/v2/entity/uniqueAttribute/type/aType?attr:aTypeAttribute=someValue.

parameters.name: typeName
parameters.description: The name of the type.

parameters.name: attr:qualifiedName
parameters.description:
The qualified name of the entity. (This is only an example. qualifiedName can
be changed to other unique attributes)

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: set of labels to be deleted

204.description: There is no content to send for this request, but the headers may be useful.

get.description:
Get all glossaries. Recommend using limit/offset to get pagination result.
Recommend using 'ignoreTermsAndCategories=true' and fetch terms/categories
separately using 'GET /datamap/api/atlas/v2/glossary/{glossaryId}/terms'
and 'GET '/datamap/api/atlas/v2/glossary/{glossaryId}/categories'.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The page size - by default there is no paging.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset for pagination purpose.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The sort order, ASC (default) or DESC.

parameters.name: ignoreTermsAndCategories
parameters.description: Whether ignore terms and categories

post.description: Create a glossary.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Body parameter.

get.description: Get a specific Glossary by its GUID.

parameters.name: glossaryId
parameters.description: The globally unique identifier for glossary.

parameters.name: glossaryId
parameters.description: The globally unique identifier for glossary.

parameters.name: ignoreTermsAndCategories
parameters.description: Whether ignore terms and categories

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Body parameter.

delete.description:
Delete a glossary. Will delete underlying terms/categories together. Recommend
separate delete terms and categories.

parameters.name: glossaryId
parameters.description: The globally unique identifier for glossary.

204.description: There is no content to send for this request, but the headers may be useful.

get.description:
Get the categories belonging to a specific glossary. Recommend using
limit/offset to get pagination result.

parameters.name: glossaryId
parameters.description: The globally unique identifier for glossary.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The page size - by default there is no paging.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset for pagination purpose.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The sort order, ASC (default) or DESC.

get.description:
Get the category headers belonging to a specific glossary. Recommend using
limit/offset to get pagination result.

parameters.name: glossaryId
parameters.description: The globally unique identifier for glossary.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The page size - by default there is no paging.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset for pagination purpose.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The sort order, ASC (default) or DESC.

get.description:
Get a specific glossary with detailed information. This API is not
recommend.

Recommend to fetch terms/categories details separately using 

GET /datamap/api/atlas/v2/glossary/{glossaryId}/terms and 

GET /datamap/api/atlas/v2/glossary/{glossaryId}/categories.

parameters.name: glossaryId
parameters.description: The globally unique identifier for glossary.

put.description:
Update the glossary partially. Some properties such as qualifiedName are not
allowed to be updated.

So far we only supports partial updating
shortDescription, longDescription, language and usage for glossary. 

Recommend
using 'ignoreTermsAndCategories=true' to reduce response body size.

parameters.name: glossaryId
parameters.description: The globally unique identifier for glossary.

parameters.name: ignoreTermsAndCategories
parameters.description: Whether ignore terms and categories

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
A map containing keys as attribute names and values as corresponding attribute
values.

get.description:
Get terms belonging to a specific glossary. Recommend using limit/offset to get
pagination result.

parameters.name: glossaryId
parameters.description: The globally unique identifier for glossary.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The page size - by default there is no paging.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset for pagination purpose.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The sort order, ASC (default) or DESC.

get.description:
Get term headers belonging to a specific glossary. Recommend using limit/offset
to get pagination result.

parameters.name: glossaryId
parameters.description: The globally unique identifier for glossary.

parameters.name: limit

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset for pagination purpose.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The sort order, ASC (default) or DESC.

parameters.name: categoryId

Update the glossary term partially. So far we only supports partial updating
shortDescription, longDescription, abbreviation, usage and status for term.

parameters.name: termId
parameters.description: The globally unique identifier for glossary term.

parameters.name: includeTermHierarchy
parameters.description: Whether include term hierarchy

A map containing keys as attribute names and values as corresponding attribute

post.description: Create glossary terms in bulk.

parameters.name: includeTermHierarchy
parameters.description: Whether include term hierarchy

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: An array of glossary term definitions to be created in bulk.

get.description:
List all related objects assigned with the specified term. Recommend using
limit/offset to get pagination result.

parameters.name: termId
parameters.description: The globally unique identifier for glossary term.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The page size - by default there is no paging.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset for pagination purpose.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The sort order, ASC (default) or DESC.

post.description:
Assign the given term to the provided list of related objects. Recommend using
small batches with multiple API calls.

[Entities Create Or Update
operation](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/purview/datamapdataplane/entity/bulk-create-or-update?tabs=HTTP)
is an alternative to assign a term to multiple entities.

parameters.name: termId
parameters.description: The globally unique identifier for glossary term.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: An array of related object IDs to which the term has to be associated.

204.description: There is no content to send for this request, but the headers may be useful.

delete.description: Delete the term assignment for the given list of related objects.

parameters.name: termId
parameters.description: The globally unique identifier for glossary term.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: An array of related object IDs from which the term has to be dissociated.

204.description: There is no content to send for this request, but the headers may be useful.

get.description:
Get all related terms for a specific term by its GUID. Limit, offset, and sort
parameters are currently not being enabled and won't work even they are passed.

parameters.name: termId
parameters.description: The globally unique identifier for glossary term.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The page size - by default there is no paging.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset for pagination purpose.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The sort order, ASC (default) or DESC.

get.description: Get lineage info of the entity specified by GUID.

parameters.name: guid
parameters.description: The globally unique identifier of the entity.

parameters.name: depth
parameters.description: The number of hops for lineage.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: The direction of the lineage, which could be INPUT, OUTPUT or BOTH.

get.description:
Return lineage info about entity.

In addition to the typeName path parameter,
attribute key-value pair(s) can be provided in the following
format

attr:[attrName]=[attrValue]

NOTE: The attrName and attrValue should be
unique across entities, eg. qualifiedName.

The REST request would look
something like this:

GET
/v2/lineage/uniqueAttribute/type/aType?attr:aTypeAttribute=someValue.

parameters.name: typeName
parameters.description: The name of the type.

parameters.name: depth
parameters.description: The number of hops for lineage.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: The direction of the lineage, which could be INPUT, OUTPUT or BOTH.

parameters.name: attr:qualifiedName
parameters.description:
The qualified name of the entity. (This is only an example. qualifiedName can
be changed to other unique attributes)

get.description: List all type definitions in bulk.

parameters.name: includeTermTemplate
parameters.description:
Whether include termtemplatedef when return all typedefs.
This is always true
when search filter type=term_template

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Typedef name as search filter when get typedefs.

put.description:
Update all types in bulk, changes detected in the type definitions would be
persisted.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Body parameter.

post.description: Create all atlas type definitions in bulk. Please avoid recreating existing types.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Body parameter.

delete.description: Delete API for all types in bulk.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Body parameter.

204.description: There is no content to send for this request, but the headers may be useful.

get.description: List all type definitions returned as a list of minimal information header.

parameters.name: includeTermTemplate
parameters.description:

entityTypes.description:
Specifying a list of entityType names in the classificationDef, ensures that
classifications can
only be applied to those entityTypes.

Any subtypes of the entity types inherit the restriction.

Any classificationDef subtypes inherit the parents entityTypes restrictions.

Any classificationDef subtypes can further restrict the parents entityTypes
restrictions by specifying a subset of the entityTypes.

An empty entityTypes list when there are no parent restrictions means there are no
restrictions.

An empty entityTypes list when there are parent
restrictions means that the subtype picks up the parents
restrictions.

If a list of entityTypes are supplied, where one inherits
from another, this will be rejected. This should encourage cleaner
classificationsDefs.

sortType.description: to specify whether the result should be sorted? If yes, whether asc or desc.

startIndex.description: The start index of the page.

AtlasRelationshipAttributeDef.description:
The relationshipEndDef represents an end of the relationship. The end of the
relationship is defined by a type, an
attribute name, cardinality and whether
it  is the container end of the relationship.

defaultValue.description: The default value of the attribute.

includeInNotification.description: Determines if it is included in notification.

name.description: The name of the attribute.

valuesMaxCount.description: The maximum count of the values.

valuesMinCount.description: The minimum count of the values.

isLegacyAttribute.description: Determines if it is a legacy attribute.

relationshipTypeName.description: The name of the relationship type.

AtlasRelationshipDef.description:
AtlasRelationshipDef is a TypeDef that defines a relationship.
As with other typeDefs the AtlasRelationshipDef has a name. Once created the
RelationshipDef has a guid.
The name and the guid are the 2 ways that the
RelationshipDef is identified.
RelationshipDefs have 2 ends, each of which
specify cardinality, an EntityDef type name and name and optionally
whether the
end is a container.
RelationshipDefs can have AttributeDefs - though only
primitive types are allowed. 
RelationshipDefs have a relationshipCategory
specifying the UML type of relationship required 
The way EntityDefs and
RelationshipDefs are intended to be used is that EntityDefs will define
AttributeDefs these AttributeDefs
will not specify an EntityDef type name as
their types.
RelationshipDefs introduce new attributes to the entity
instances. For example
EntityDef A might have attributes attr1,attr2,attr3

EntityDef B might have attributes attr4,attr5,attr6 
RelationshipDef
AtoB might define 2 ends 

end1:  type A, name attr7
end2:  type B, name attr8 

When an instance of EntityDef A is created, it
will have attributes attr1,attr2,attr3,attr7 
When an instance of EntityDef
B is created, it will have attributes attr4,attr5,attr6,attr8

In this way
relationshipDefs can be authored separately from entityDefs and can inject
relationship attributes into
the entity instances

endDef1.description:
The relationshipEndDef represents an end of the relationship. The end of the
relationship is defined by a type, an
attribute name, cardinality and whether
it  is the container end of the relationship.

endDef2.description:
The relationshipEndDef represents an end of the relationship. The end of the
relationship is defined by a type, an
attribute name, cardinality and whether
it  is the container end of the relationship.

relationshipCategory.description:
The Relationship category determines the style of relationship around
containment and lifecycle.
UML terminology is used for the values.
ASSOCIATION is a relationship with no containment. 
COMPOSITION and AGGREGATION are containment relationships.
The difference being in the lifecycles of the container and its children. 
In the COMPOSITION case, the children cannot exist without the container.
For AGGREGATION, the life cycles of the container and children are totally independent.

relationshipCategory.description:
The Relationship category determines the style of relationship around
containment and lifecycle.
UML terminology is used for the values.

ASSOCIATION is a relationship with no containment. 
COMPOSITION and AGGREGATION are containment relationships.

The difference being in the lifecycles of the container and its children.

be at least 1 character, and no more than 100 characters.

The value must be a number between 1 and 100.

QueryOptions.description: The search query of advanced search request.

keywords.description: The keywords applied to all searchable fields.

limit.description:
The limit of the number of the search result. default value is 50; maximum
value is 1000.

continuationToken.description:
The token used to get next batch of data. Default 'Null' to get the first
batch, and will return new token in each response unless there's no more data.

orderby.description: The sort order of search results, can specify multiple fields.

filter.description: The filter for the search. See examples for the usage of supported filters.

facets.description: The facets for search. See examples for the usage of supported facets.

QueryResult.description: The result of the search result.

@search.count.description:
The total number of search results (not the number of documents in a single
page).

@search.count.approximate.description: 'True' if the '@search.count' is an approximate value and vise versa.

continuationToken.description: The token used to get next batch of data. Absent if there's no more data.

@search.facets.description:
A facet list that consists of index fields assetType ,classification,
contactId, and label. When the facet is specified in the request, the value of
the facet is returned as an element of @search.facets.

SearchFacetItem.description: The content of a search facet result item.

count.description: The count of the facet item.

facet.description: The name of the facet item.

sort.description: Define the sorting criteria for items

SearchFacetItemValue.description: The content of a search facet result item.

count.description: The count of the facet item.

value.description: The name of the facet item.

SearchFacetResultValue.description:
A facet list that consists of index fields assetType ,classification,
contactId, and label. When the facet is specified in the request, the value of
the facet is returned as an element of @search.facets.

SearchHighlights.description:
A highlight list that consists of index fields id ,qualifiedName, name,
description, entityType. When the keyword appears in those fields, the value of
the field, attached with emphasis mark, is returned as an element of
@search.highlights.

name.description: Name

SearchResultValue.description: The value item of the search result.

@search.score.description:
The search score calculated by the search engine. The results are ordered by
search score by default.

objectType.description:
The object type of the record. Object type is the top-level property to
distinguish whether a record is an asset or a term.

updateTime.description: The last update time of the record. The Unix epoch format.

qualifiedName.description: The qualified name of the record.

term.description: The terms assigned to the asset.

The type name of the term. Could be AtlasGlossary, AtlasGlossaryTerm or
AtlasGlossaryCategory.

glossary.description: The glossary name of the term.

termTemplate.description: The term template names used by the term.

facet.description: The content of a search facet result item.

keywords.description:
The keywords applied to all fields that support suggest operation. It must be
at least 1 character, and no more than 100 characters. In the index schema we
defined a default suggester which lists all the supported fields and specifies
a search mode.

limit.description:
The number of suggestions we hope to return. The default value is 5. The value
must be a number between 1 and 100.

SuggestResult.description: The result item of the search suggest.

SuggestResultValue.description: The value item of the search suggest.

@search.score.description:
The search score calculated by the search engine. The results are ordered by
search score by default.

@search.text.description:
The target text that contains the keyword as prefix. The keyword is wrapped
with emphasis mark.
